title: 1967년 Wysong 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Wysong. 판결일: 1967-04-06. 법원: Court of Customs and Patent Appeals.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Application of Halbert C. WHITE and Don v. Wysong
**판결일**: 1967-04-06
**법원**: Court of Customs and Patent Appeals
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Almond, Kirkpatrick, Rich, Smith, William, Worley

## 변호인

Neal A. Waldrop, Detroit, Mich., Theodore Post, Midland, Mich., for appellants., Joseph Schimmel, Washington, D. C. (Jack E. Armore, Washington, D. C., of counsel), for the Commissioner of Patents.

## 인용

- 374 F.2d 1010
- 54 C.C.P.A. 1255

## 판결문 요약

374 F.2d 1010
    Application of Halbert C. WHITE and Don V. Wysong.
    Patent Appeal No. 7725.
    United States Court of Customs and Patent Appeals.
    April 6, 1967.
    
      Neal A. Waldrop, Detroit, Mich., Theodore Post, Midland, Mich., for appellants.
      Joseph Schimmel, Washington, D. C. (Jack E. Armore, Washington, D. C., of counsel), for the Commissioner of Patents.
      Before WORLEY, Chief Judge, RICH, SMITH, ALMOND, Judges, and WILLIAM H. KIRKPATRICK.*
      KIRKPATRICK, Judge.
    
    
      1
      This is an appeal from the decision of the Board of Appeals affirming the rejection of claims 1, 3 and 4 of appellants' application serial No. 133,804, filed August 25, 1961, for "Method of Preparing di-L-lysine.D-Camphorate." No claim has been allowed.
    
    
      2
      Claim 1 is the broadest of the appealed claims and it reads:
    
    
      3
      1. In a method of recovering di-Llysine.D-camphorate from an aqueous medium in which it is formed by reaction between proportions of 0.35 to 0.65 mole of D-camphoric acid and 1 mole of DL-lysine, the improvement which consists in adjusting therein the proportion of water and of methanol to 80 to 160 ml. of water and 50 to 250 ml. of methanol per mole of DL-lysine reactant and adjusting the temperature of said aqueous medium to within the range 45° to 90° C. to precipitate therefrom high purity crystalline di-Llysine.D-camphorate and recovering said crystalline d-L-lysine.D-camphorate directly ...

sources.name: Harvard Law - Case Law Access Project
